claim: Hawthorne Road was a cricket ground located in Bootle, England.
Bootle F.C. played at Hawthorne Road from 1884 to 1893.
In 1889, Bootle F.C. opened a seated stand and covered stand behind the western goal.
The record attendance at Hawthorne Road was set on December 26, 1889, with 20,000 spectators watching Bootle play Everton in a friendly match.
On September 10, 1892, Bootle beat Sheffield United 2–0 in front of 4,000 spectators during their first League match played at Hawthorne Road.
The ground remained open for cricket after the football team left and was briefly home to Bootle Athletic before being built over due to housing construction on Wadham Road.
Echo & the Bunnymen released "Nothing Lasts Forever" in 1997, after reforming the band with Ian McCulloch, Will Sergeant, and Les Pattinson.
"Nothing Lasts Forever" was also the first single from their 1997 album Evergreen.
The single reached number 8 on the UK Singles Chart in 1997.
There were three separate CD versions of "Nothing Lasts Forever", each with different track listings apart from the title track.
The French and German versions of the CD releases also had different track listings.
The video for "Nothing Lasts Forever" was shot in Marrakech, Morocco.
Chris Adams published the book Turquoise Days: The Weird World of Echo & the Bunnymen in 2002, citing a reference to the song on page 276.
Janice Long played "Nothing Lasts Forever" for the last time on her final show on Radio 2 on January 26, 2017.
"Nothing Lasts Forever" was also the last song played by Janice Long on The Christian O'Connell Breakfast Show on Absolute Radio on May 18, 2018.
All tracks from the UK 7-inch release were written by Will Sergeant, Ian McCulloch, and Les Pattinson.
The UK CD release had track listings that included "#Nothing Lasts Forever" – 3:53, "#Watchtower" – 4:25, and "#Polly" – 4:17.
The UK alternate CD release had different track listings, including "#Colour Me In" – 4:00 and "#Antelope" – 2:44.
The French/German CD release included the tracks "#Nothing Lasts Forever", "#Colour Me In", "#Antelope", and "#Jonny".
The French/German alternate CD release had different track listings, including "#Watchtower", "#Polly", and "#Hurricane".
